item.title: Peanut Butter Blossom Cookies
item.dc:creator: boydjdboyd
item.content:encoded: [recipe] [recipe-ingredients] - 1/2 cup granulated sugar (plus extra for coating) - 1/2 cup brown sugar - 1/2 cup creamy peanut butter - 1/2 cup (1 stick) softened butter - 1 egg - 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour - 3/4 teaspoon baking soda - 1/2 teaspoon baking powder - 3+ dozen Wilbur buds [/recipe-ingredients] [recipe-directions] 1. preheat oven to 375 1. in mixer, beat sugars, peanut butter, regular butter, and egg. 1. stir in flour, baking soda and baking powder. 1. Scoop onto cookie sheet in 1 in (1 oz baller) balls, 2 in. apart. 1. (Optional) roll in granulated sugar. 1. Bake 8-10 minutes, until edges GBD. 1. Immediate press 1 bud into the center of each cookie. [/recipe-directions] [/recipe] Source: Classic Peanut Butter Blossom Cookies

item.title: Roast Turkey ala Boyd
item.dc:creator: boydjdboyd
item.content:encoded:
[recipe]
[recipe-directions title="Spatchcock the turkey."] This means use kitchen shears to remove the backbone by cutting through the ribs along each side. Then flip the bird and press on the breast to flatten it.
Keep the scraps (neck, backbone, anything trimmed) for making gravy. I usually try to buy more turkey necks or wings to suplement, BTW. [/recipe-directions]
[recipe-ingredients title="Dry Brine Ingredients"] - half a cup of Diamond Crystal kosher salt (or six tablespoons Morton's kosher salt) - 2 tbsp of baking powder in a bowl. [/recipe-ingredients]
Be prepared to not use all of it.
[recipe-directions] Pat turkey dry. Generously sprinkle the salt mixture on all surfaces. The turkey should be well coated but not encrusted.
Place the turkey on a rack set in a half sheet pan and refrigerate, uncovered, for 12 to 24 hours, or loosly covered for up to 3 days.
[/recipe-directions]
[recipe-ingredients title="Herb Butter Rub Ingredients"] - 4 cloves garlic - 1/4 c chopped chives - 1/4 c fresh parsley leaves - 1/4 c fresh sage - 2 tbsp fresh thyme - 1 shallot, roughly sliced - 1 stick butter, hard and chopped to 1/4-1/2 in chunks. [/recipe-ingredients]
[recipe-directions] 1. Food process all ingredients. 1. Allow to warm to room temperature. 1. Rub under and over skin before roasting bird. [/recipe-directions]
[recipe-directions title="Roasting, Finally"] 1. Pre-heat oven to 450 degrees F. 1. Spread carrots, celery, onions on bottom of roasting pan or baking sheet. 1. Place bird on top. 1. Toast until the breast is over 150 degrees F and the thighs are at least 165 degrees F. About 75-90 minutes for a 12-14 lbs bird. 1. If any part of the turkey is browning more than you like, put some foil over that portion. 1. Remove turkey from oven, cover with aluminum foil, and wait 20 minutes. 1. Carve and serve. [/recipe-directions]
[recipe-notes]
Here are the main sources used for this process:
https://www.seriouseats.com/recipes/2014/11/herb-butter-rubbed-crisp-skinned-butterflied-spatchcock-roast-turkey-thanksgiving-recipe.html
https://www.seriouseats.com/2012/11/how-to-spatchcock-cook-turkey-thanksgiving-fast-easy-way-spatchcocked-slideshow.html
https://www.seriouseats.com/recipes/2012/11/butterfiled-roast-turkey-with-gravy-recipe.html
https://www.seriouseats.com/2014/11/quick-and-dirty-guide-to-brining-turkey-chicken-thanksgiving.html
[/recipe-notes]
[/recipe]

item.title: Bisquick Ultimate Pancakes
item.dc:creator: boydjdboyd
item.content:encoded:
[recipe] [recipe-note] Originally taken from Bisquick box, but it doesn't always show up on the boxes, thus the need to add it here. [/recipe-note] [recipe-ingredients] - 4 c Bisquick - 2 tbsp sugar - 4 tsp baking powder
- 4 tbsp lemon juice - 2 c milk - 4 eggs [/recipe-ingredients] [recipe-directions] 1. Heat pan or griddle to 375 deg F (about medium to medium high) 1. Mix all ingredients. 1. Make each pancake about 1/4 c 1. Cook until edges dry and bubbles mostly stop, then flip and cook slightly less time on the second side. [/recipe-directions] [/recipe]

item.title: Roast Brussels Sprouts w/ Mustard Dressing
item.dc:creator: boydjdboyd
item.content:encoded:
[recipe] [recipe-ingredients] - 2 pounds brussels sprouts, halved or quartered. - 1/4 c olive oil for roasting - 1/4 c olive oil for dressing - 2 tbsp vinegar (sherry, apple cider, tarragon, many choices will work fine here) - 1 tbsp grainy mustard. - Salt - Pepper
[/recipe-ingredients] [recipe-directions] 1. Preheat oven to 450 deg f. 1. Line half-sheet pan with aluminum foil. 1. Toss brussel sprouts with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on half sheet pan. 1. Roast for 20-30 minutes until golden and desired mix of crunchy/soft. Flip after 10 minutes.
1. While roasting, in a bowl that is large enough to eventually toss the brussels sprouts, whisk together vinegar, mustard, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp pepper. Slowly add 1/4c oil.
1. Add roasted sprouts to dressing bowl and toss.
[/recipe-directions] [/recipe]

item.title: Flan V2
item.dc:creator: boydjdboyd
item.content:encoded:
From: https://www.davidlebovitz.com/creme-caramel-flan-recipe/
[recipe] [recipe-ingredients] Caramel: * 200g sugar * a few drops of corn syrup * 60ml water * a few drops lemon juice
For the custard: * 8 large eggs room temperature (20 to 25 Â°C) * 130g sugar * 800ml whole milk * Seeds from 1 vanilla bean or 1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract [/recipe-ingredients]
[recipe-directions] 1. Preheat the oven to 300ÂºF (150ÂºC).
1. Lightly butter a 9-inch loaf pan. Have a baking dish with high sides to make a water bath to bake the custard in.
1. To make the caramel, spread the 200g of sugar in an even layer in a skillet. Pour the water over it and add a few drops of lemon juice. Cook the sugar over medium-high heat until it reaches 245Â°F to 250Â°F.
1. When sugar is a deep amber color, remove from heat; pour the caramel into the buttered mold. Coat evenly. Set aside to cool. It will need to be under 120Â°F before the custard is added.
1. Whisk the eggs and sugar. Add vanilla. Gradually add the milk, whisking constantly.
1. Pour custard into the pan over the cooled caramel. Place flan in baking dish. Pour warm water into the outer dish, until it reaches over halfway up the outside flan.
1. Bake the uncovered flan in the oven 1 hour, 20 minutes, or until barely set.
1. Remove from the oven. Rest in the water bath for 30 more minutes.
1. Transfer the flan to a cooling rack. Let cool to room temperature, then refrigerate until completely chilled, preferably overnight. [/recipe-directions] [/recipe]

item.title: Semolina Pasta Dough
item.dc:creator: boydjdboyd
item.content:encoded:
[recipe] [recipe-ingredients] - 600g semolina flour - 6 eggs - 1 tsp salt [/recipe-ingredients]
[recipe-directions] Mix in stand mixer bowl by hand until shaggy, then dough hook until elastic, about 10 minutes.
[/recipe-directions]
[/recipe]

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: If necessary, you can you all-purpose flour to replace semolina flour. You can also mix with the dough hook until elastic.
If dought ball doesn't form, use a teaspoon of water.
If the dough ball still doesn't form, add more teaspoons of water.

item.title: Crockpot Collard Greens
item.dc:creator: boydjdboyd
item.content:encoded:
Based loosely on: https://momswithcrockpots.com/slow-cooked-collard-greens/
[recipe] [recipe-ingredients] - 1 smoked ham hock - 6 slices thick bacon - 8 c collard greens (tough ribs and stems removed, torn into 2" strips) - 1 tsp salt - 1/2 tsp black pepper - 2 cloves garlic - 1 large onion or 1/4 c onion flakes - 2 cups chicken broth - 2 cups water - pinch red pepper flakes
[/recipe-ingredients] [recipe-directions] 1. Rinse collards, remove thick stems, tear into small strips
1. Cook bacon in skillet.
1. Place bacon and drippings in crock pot.
1. Add rest of ingredients to crock pot.
1. Cook on low for 6 hours or high for 3 hours.
1. Remove hock, discard bones and other inedible bits. Shred rest and return to crockpot.
1. Serve.
[/recipe-directions] [/recipe]

item.title: Soft Caramels
item.dc:creator: boydjdboyd
item.content:encoded:
[recipe]
[recipe-ingredients]
- 1c sugar
- 1/2c brown sugar
- 1/2c (1 stick) butter (preferably unsalted)
- 1/2c milk
- 1/2c heavy cream
- 1/2c light corn syrup
- 1 tsp vanilla
- kosher salt or something flaky or chunky to top
[/recipe-ingredients]
[recipe-directions]
1. Butter a 6x9 baking dish.
1. Mix all but vanilla in a 3qt or larger pan. NOTE: This will foam up a lot more than you might expect, so be generous in pan size.
1. Heat on medium heat until everything is melted together, approximately 20 minutes. Stir occasionally.
1. Continue to cook until temperature is 245f to 250f, approximately 25 minutes.
1. Poor into baking dish. Sprinkle salt on top (optional).
1. Cool on counter until room temperature.
1. Place in refrigerator 1 hour.
1. Extract from dish and cut into bite size pieces.
[/recipe-directions]
[/recipe]

item.title: Lemon Pancake
item.dc:creator: boydjdboyd
item.content:encoded: [recipe] [recipe-ingredients] - 2 whole lemons, zested & squeezed - 2-1/4 cups milk - 1 tbsp vanilla - 3 cups flour - 1/4 cup sugar - 2 tbsp baking powder - 1/4 tsp salt - 2 eggs, beaten - 1/4 cup melted butter [/recipe-ingredients] [recipe-directions] 1. Add 3/4 of the lemon juice to the milk, then set aside for 5 minutes. 1. Mix dry ingredients in mixing bowl. 1. Add soured milk and vanilla, stirring gently, until partly combined. 1. Add eggs and melted butter. 1. All lemon zest. 1. Adjust with milk or flour to desired consistency. 1. Cook like normal pancakes 1/4-1/2 cup at a time. [/recipe-directions] [recipe-notes] This originally was a Pioneer Woman recipe. What I particularly liked about it was combining buttermilk pancakes with lemon pancakes by using the common substitute of souring milk with lemon juice to replace butter milk. [/recipe-notes] [/recipe]

item.title: Rice Crispy Treats
item.dc:creator: boydjdboyd
item.content:encoded: [recipe] [recipe-ingredients] - 8 cups rice crispies - 20 oz marshmallows - 1 stick (1/2 c) butter - 1 tsp vanilla - pinch salt [/recipe-ingredients] [recipe-directions] 1. Prepare a 9"x9" pan. Butter will work, but a parchment sling coated with butter will make removal even easier. 1. Melt butter over low in a pan that will be large enough to eventually add the rice crispies. A wok or a large metal mixing bowl may be ideal. 1. Let butter cool to 140Â°F. 1. Melt marshmallows into butter. This may require placing back on heat, but try to keep temperature around 140Â°F. Lower temperatures help prevent the treats being tough. 1. Add vanilla and salt. 1. Add rice crispies. 1. Move mixture into 9"x9" pan, and allow to cool. [/recipe-directions] [/recipe]

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: 8 cups RC is about 8oz by weight

item.title: Cucumber Salad
item.dc:creator: boydjdboyd
item.content:encoded:
As made 2020-07-16

4 large cucumbers, sliced thinly

2-3 tsp table salt

Place pukcumbers in strainer in a large bowl. Toss with salt, let sit 15 minutes, pour of liquid several time so cucumbers aren't sitting in it.

Slice 1 red onion.

Mix: 2tbsp dried dill

2tsp sugar

2Tbsp apple cider vinegar

4 spins black pepper

4-6Tbsp Mayo

Pour of last liquid from cucumbers and place them in a bowl, toss in red onion and mix. Chill thoroughly, serve cold.

item.title: Deb's Playdough
item.dc:creator: boydjdboyd
item.content:encoded:
[recipe] [recipe-ingredients] - 1 c flour - 1 c water - 1/3c salt - 1 tbsp vegatable oil - 2 tsp cream of tartar - food coloring [/recipe-ingredients] [recipe-directions]
  1. mix ingredients together in a pan
  2. cook stirring over low/medium until the mixture is thickened and gathers around the spatula and the temperature exceeds 160 Â°F
  3. Remove dough to non-stick surface to cool.
[/recipe-directions] [/recipe]

item.title: Best Baked Potatoes from Cooks Illustrated
item.dc:creator: boydjdboyd
item.content:encoded:
[recipe]
[recipe-notes]
SERVES 4
[/recipe-notes]
[recipe-ingredients] - 4 russet potatoes (7-to 9-ounce). unpeeled, each lightly pricked with fork in 6 places
- tablespoon vegetable oil
- Salt and pepper [/recipe-ingredients]
[recipe-directions] 1) Adjust oven rack to middle position and heat oven to 450 degrees.
2) Wash potatoes and poke with a fork or knife 4-6 times.
3) Dissolve 2 tablespoons salt in 1/2 cup water in large bowl. Place potatoes in bowl and toss so exteriors of potatoes are evenly moistened.
4) Transfer potatoes to wire rack set in rimmed baking sheet and bake until center of largest potato registers 205 degrees, 45 minutes to 1 hour.
5) Remove potatoes from oven and brush tops and sides with oil. Return potatoes to oven and continue to bake for 10 minutes.
6) Remove potatoes from oven and, using paring knife, make 2 slits, forming X, in each potato. Using clean dish towel, hold ends and squeeze slightly to push flesh up and out. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately. Open up the potatoes immediately after removal from the oven in step 3 so steam can escape. Top them as desired, or with one of our toppings.
[/recipe-directions]
[/recipe]

item.title: Mom's Cheesecake
item.dc:creator: boydjdboyd
item.content:encoded:
[recipe] [recipe-ingredients Â title="Crust Ingredients"]
  • 10 graham crackers, crushed
  • 1/4 c sugar
  • 1/4 c butter (melted)
[/recipe-ingredients] [recipe-directions]
  1. Mix ingredients, press into spring form pan.
[/recipe-directions] [recipe-ingredients Â title="Cake Ingredients"] - 16 oz cream cheese (room temperature) - 3 eggs - 1/2 c sugar [/recipe-ingredients] [recipe-directions]
  1. beat cream cheese in mixer
  2. add eggs and sugar, mix thoroughly
  3. pour over graham cracker crust in spring form pan.
  4. Bake a 350Â°F for 30 minutes.
  5. cool on rack for 15 minutes
[/recipe-directions] [recipe-ingredients Â title="Topping Ingredients"]
  • 1/4 c sugar
  • 16 oz sour cream
[/recipe-ingredients] [recipe-directions]
  1. Preheat oven to 475Â°F.
  2. mix sugar and sour cream.
  3. pour over cooled cheese cake.
  4. bake for 5 minutes or until lightly golden in spots.
  5. cool then cover and refrigerate until an hour before service.
[/recipe-directions] [/recipe]

item.title: Rachel's Blender Hollandaise
item.dc:creator: boydjdboyd
item.content:encoded:
[recipe]

[recipe-ingredients]

- 1 stick hot melted salted butter

- 3 large egg yolks

- 2 tbsp lemon juice

- White pepper to taste

- Cayenne powder

[/recipe-ingredients]

[recipe-directions]

1. Blend yolks with pepper and a little lemon juice until you smell it while it's moving.

1. After 3 minutes, slowly pour in melted butter in a steady stream while the blender is on high.

1. Blend on high 3-5 minutes adding lemon juice to taste.

1. Add cayenne pepper to taste at end.

[/recipe-directions]

[/recipe]

item.title: Fire Sauce
item.dc:creator: boydjdboyd
item.content:encoded:
Inspired by Taco Bell Fire Sauce.â Starting point: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SfUouu0mrqo
Makes about a pint.
[recipe] [recipe-ingredients]
â¢ 6oz can Tomato Paste â¢ 3 Cups Water â¢ 2 Tbsp White Vinegar â¢ 1/2 Cup Jalapeno Slices â¢ 1 Tbsp Chili Powder â¢ 1 Tbsp Dried Onion flakes â¢ 2 Tsp Salt â¢ 2 Tsp Cornstarch â¢ 1 Tsp Cayenne Pepper â¢ 1 Tsp Sugar â¢ Dash of Onion & Garlic Powder
[/recipe-ingredients]
[recipe-directions]
1. Blend ingredients.
1. Bring mixture to a boil in a sauce pan and simmer for 10 minutes.

item.title: Boxed Mac & Cheese + Hot Dogs
item.dc:creator: boydjdboyd
item.content:encoded:
[recipe]
[recipe-ingredients]
- 2 boxes Kraft (or similar enough generic, like Wegmans) Mac & Cheese
- 1 package (1 pound) pork/turkey dogs (all beef or beef included aren't as good)
- 3/4 c milk
- 1/2 c butter (1 stick), in approximately 8 chunks
- 2 tsp Mustard powder
[/recipe-ingredients]
[recipe-directions]

1. Boil water (about 12 cups).

1. Chop hot dogs into ~ 1/2" sections.

1. Add pasta from boxes and hot dogs, cook 6 minutes

1. Drain pasta and dogs and return to pan, off burner.

1. Add butter, mustard, and cheese packages. Stir until melted.

1. Add Milk, stir in.

[/recipe-directions]
[/recipe]
